article_title: Covington's High Court Team Captain: Robert A. Long
article_text:
Covington's High Court Team Captain: Robert A. Long

Law360, New York (November 25, 2014, 5:13 PM ET) -- In November 2011, Covington & Burling LLP partner Robert A. Long received the most unexpected cold call of his career, one that would place him front and center in the nation’s bitter fight over the legal viability of the Affordable Care Act.



The caller was a representative from the U.S. Supreme Court, which wanted Long to lead off three days of oral arguments by tackling the thorny threshold issue of whether the Anti-Injunction Act of 1867 would prohibit the case from being heard until a taxpayer...

article_metadata.description: Covington & Burling LLP’s Robert A. Long talks to Law360 about the underappreciated power of understated advocacy, the deeper meaning of his collection of high court souvenirs, and how a cold call from the Supreme Court put him front and center in one of the most contentious legal battles of the decade.
